Look, Bob, I'm not budging on my share. I'm still taking the majority, but I'm offering you more than before. Accept it before the inflation eats away at what you'll receive.
Alice, we're getting close to the end.  If we keep going, the inflation will hurt both of us.  Let's split it 35/65, and we can both walk away with a decent amount.
Bob, we're running out of time.  I'm willing to give you 30% - take it or we risk getting nothing at all!
Alice, we're getting dangerously close to the end. Let's compromise at 25/75. This is my final offer before the inflation really starts to bite.  It's the best deal for both of us right now.
Bob, I'm giving you a larger share than before. This is my last offer. If you reject it, we both lose everything.
